game.player

Class AIBehavior

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.player.AIBehavior
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Behavior

    public class AIBehavior
extends java.lang.Object
implements Behavior
    Since:
    29/03/2012 Basic artificial intelligence (AI) Simple implementation of AI that can get points by getting different bonuses and move around the game board.
    Version:
    3
    Author:
    Asen Lekov

      • AIBehavior

        public AIBehavior(Difficulty AIdifficult,
          Game actions)
        Use AIBehavior(Difficulty, Game) to attach behavior to AI
        Parameters:
        AIdifficult - behavior difficulty (easy, normal, hard)
        actions - game that provides access to all game components such players, bonuses, board e.g.

    • Method Detail

      • calcDistance

        private double calcDistance(int x,
                  int y,
                  Cell destination)
        Parameters:
        x - x cord of player
        y - y cord of player
        destination - Destination cell
        Returns:
        A* distance from player to target cell
        Since:
        29/03/2012 Simple implementation of A* pathfinding

      • calcDistance

        private double calcDistance(Player AI,
                  int x,
                  int y)
        Parameters:
        AI - Player distance we want FROM
        x - Target x cord
        y - Target y cord
        Returns:
        A* distance from player to target cell
        Since:
        14/04/2012 Simple implementation of A* pathfinding

        Player AI,

        Use easy(Board, Player, int) to define attached behavior to EASY
        Parameters:
        b - board AI play on
        AI - player
        randomNumber - random number, chance to take some bonuses

        private Direction getNewFreshDirection(Board b,
                             Player p,
                             Direction l)
        Parameters:
        b - Board that player play on
        p - Target player
        l - Last direction of palyer
        Returns:
        new direction different from last & available

      • getNextDirectionToBonus

        private Direction getNextDirectionToBonus(Player AI,
                                BonusObject bonus)
        Parameters:
        AI - Player who will get bonus
        bonus - Target bonus
        Returns:
        Shortest direction based on A* Uses calcDistance(int, int, Cell) & calcDistance(Player, int, int)
        Since:
        29/03/2012 Calculating what is shortest direction from player to bonus

      • setDirection

        private void setDirection(Direction dir)

      • shouldAIGetArrow

        private boolean shouldAIGetArrow(Player AI,
                       Arrow arrow)
        Parameters:
        AI - who will take arrow bonus
        arrow - which arrow bonus will be taken
        Returns:
        true if player when get Arrow bonus will take new cells, otherwise false
